alert.note: Alert for Adair; Adams; Cass; Clarke; Decatur; Lucas; Madison; Ringgold; Taylor; Union; Warren; Wayne (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued January 12 at 3:32PM CST until January 16 at 12:00PM CST by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...Blizzard Conditions Continue into Saturday... ...Life Threatening Wind Chills Expected Saturday into Early Next Week... .A multi-faceted dangerous winter storm will continue to affect Iowa into Saturday. This dangerous storm will continue to bring additional light snow across much of the state today and tomorrow with additional accumulations of an inch or two forecast through Saturday. Winds will continue to increase, with life threatening blizzard conditions at least into Saturday. Dangerous temperatures follow into the weekend through early next week, with wind chill values down to 45 below zero expected. ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST SATURDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON CST TUESDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM TO 6 PM CST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Total snow accumulations of up to an inch or two. For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 45 below zero at times. For the Winter Weather Advisory, blowing snow and reduced visibilities under a mile possible. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Southwest into south central Iowa. * WHEN...For the Blizzard Warning, until 6 AM CST Saturday. For the Wind Chill Warning, from midnight tonight to noon CST Tuesday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 6 AM to 6 PM CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest travel conditions, check the Iowa 511 app, www.511ia.org, or dial 511.
